en.title:
FLASH CARD TIME
HUMAN BODY SYSTEM
en.confirmNewGameDesc: There is already a game in progress. Are you sure you want to start a new game?
en.start_intro0_1: I’m here to help you go over your body’s various <color=#ff807b>systems</color>, and their associated <color=#ff807b>subsystems</color> (<color=#ffe08f>organs</color> and <color=#ffe08f>tissues</color>).
en.start_intro0_2: As you may know, your body contains trillions of <color=#ffe08f>cells</color>!
en.start_intro0_3: The <color=#ffe08f>cells</color> form the many <color=#ffe08f>tissues</color> of your body.
en.start_intro0_4: The <color=#ffe08f>organs</color> are made up of <color=#ffe08f>tissues</color>, and <color=#9cd395>work together</color> to perform the functions of your body.
en.start_intro2_0: The <color=#ff807b>circulatory system</color> (also called cardiovascular system) <color=#9cd395>helps circulate</color> <color=#ffe08f>blood and nutrients</color> around your body. Think of it as the super highway in your body.
en.start_intro3_0: The <color=#ffe08f>heart</color> is part of the <color=#ff807b>circulatory subsystem</color>.  It <color=#9cd395>pumps</color> <color=#ffe08f>oxygenated blood</color> to the body and <color=#ffe08f>deoxygenated blood</color> to the <color=#ffe08f>lungs</color>.
en.start_intro4_0: Now let’s play a little card game to match these <color=#ff807b>systems</color> and <color=#ffe08f>organs</color> based on their <color=#9cd395>functions</color>.
en.start_intro4_1: Simply drag the correct card into the slot to answer the question.
en.start_multi_questions: Now for the following questions, I need you to answer with two cards.
en.start_lesson_0_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for <color=#9cd395>distributing</color> nutrients, <color=#9cd395>filtering</color> out wastes, and <color=#9cd395>transport</color> immunity around the body?
en.start_lesson_0_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>circulatory system</color> consists of: <color=#ffe08f>the heart, blood vessels, blood cells</color>.
en.start_lesson_0_subsystem_question: Which of these is part of the <color=#ff807b>circulatory system</color> that <color=#9cd395>pumps</color> <color=#ffe08f>blood cells</color> through the <color=#ffe08f>blood vessels</color>?
en.start_lesson_0_subsystem_result0: Your <color=#ffe08f>heart</color> <color=#9cd395>pumps</color> <color=#ffe08f>blood cells</color> through your <color=#ffe08f>blood vessels</color>. <color=#ffe08f>Blood</color> <color=#9cd395>provides</color> <color=#ffe08f>oxygen and nutrients</color>, as well as <color=#9cd395>assists in the removal</color> of <color=#ffe08f>metabolic wastes</color>.
en.start_lesson_1_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for the <color=#9cd395>digestion</color> and <color=#9cd395>absorption</color> of food?
en.start_lesson_1_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>digestive system</color> consists of organs working together to <color=#9cd395>convert</color> <color=#ffe08f>food</color> into <color=#ffe08f>energy and basic nutrients</color> to feed the entire body.
en.start_lesson_1_subsystem_question: Which of these is part of the <color=#ff807b>digestive system</color>?
en.start_lesson_1_subsystem_result0: The <color=#ffe08f>intestines</color> consist of two major subdivisions: the small intestine and the large intestine. <color=#ffe08f>Chemicals</color> from other organs travel here to <color=#9cd395>digest</color> food, and <color=#9cd395>extract</color> nutrients.
en.start_lesson_2_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for the <color=#9cd395>storage</color> and <color=#9cd395>discharge</color> of <color=#ffe08f>wastes</color> from the body?
en.start_lesson_2_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>excretory system</color> <color=#9cd395>removes</color> <color=#ffe08f>wastes</color>, so as to <color=#9cd395>prevent damage</color> to the body.
en.start_lesson_2_subsystem_question: Which <color=#ffe08f>organ</color> is responsible for the <color=#9cd395>production, storage, and elimination</color> of <color=#ffe08f>urine</color>?
en.start_lesson_2_subsystem_result0: <color=#ffe08f>Blood</color> enters the <color=#ffe08f>kidneys</color> in order to be <color=#9cd395>cleansed</color> of urea and other wastes. These toxic elements eventually travel to the <color=#ffe08f>bladder</color>, ready to be <color=#9cd395>extracted</color>.
en.start_lesson_3_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for the <color=#ffe08f>voluntary</color> and <color=#ffe08f>involuntary</color> <color=#9cd395>movements</color> in the body?
en.start_lesson_3_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>muscular system</color> consists of skeletal, smooth and cardiac muscles. It permits <color=#9cd395>movement</color> of the body, <color=#9cd395>maintains posture</color>, and <color=#9cd395>circulates blood</color> throughout the body.
en.start_lesson_3_subsystem_question: Which <color=#ffe08f>organ</color> is responsible for the <color=#ffe08f>voluntary</color> and <color=#ffe08f>involuntary</color> <color=#9cd395>movements</color> in the body?
en.start_lesson_3_subsystem_result0: The <color=#ffe08f>muscles</color> allow <color=#9cd395>movement</color> of the body, <color=#9cd395>maintain posture</color>, and <color=#9cd395>circulate blood</color> throughout the body.
en.start_lesson_4_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for <color=#9cd395>controlling</color> and <color=#9cd395>coordinating</color> the <color=#ff807b>other systems</color> of the body?
en.start_lesson_4_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>nervous system</color> <color=#9cd395>coordinates</color> the body's actions and <color=#9cd395>transmits signals</color> to and from different parts of the body. These signals are transmitted via <color=#ffe08f>neurons</color>.
en.start_lesson_4_subsystem_question: Which <color=#ffe08f>organ</color> is responsible for <color=#9cd395>controlling</color> and <color=#9cd395>coordinating</color> the <color=#ff807b>other systems</color> of the body?
en.start_lesson_4_subsystem_result0: The <color=#ffe08f>brain</color> is an organ that serves as the center of the <color=#ff807b>nervous system</color>.  This is where all your <color=#9cd395>senses</color> are processed.  There lies all of your thoughts, experiences, and feelings.
en.start_lesson_5_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is involved in the <color=#9cd395>intake</color> and <color=#9cd395>exchange</color> of <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> and <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color> between the body and the environment?
en.start_lesson_5_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>respiratory system</color> works closely together with the <color=#ff807b>circulatory system</color> with the exchange of <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> and <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color>.
en.start_lesson_5_subsystem_question: Which <color=#ffe08f>organ</color> is involved in the <color=#9cd395>intake</color> and <color=#9cd395>exchange</color> of <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> and <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color> between the body and the environment?
en.start_lesson_5_subsystem_result0: The passage of air into the <color=#ffe08f>lungs</color> to <color=#9cd395>supply</color> the body with <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> is known as <color=#9cd395>inhalation</color>, and the passage of air out of the lungs to <color=#9cd395>expel</color> <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color> is known as <color=#9cd395>exhalation</color>.
en.start_lesson_6_system_question: Which <color=#ff807b>system</color> is responsible for the <color=#9cd395>continual existence</color> of mankind?
en.start_lesson_6_system_result0: The <color=#ff807b>reproductive system</color> is a system of <color=#ffe08f>sex organs</color> in the body which work together for the purpose of <color=#9cd395>sexual reproduction</color>. It takes two to tango.
en.start_lesson_6_subsystem_question: Which <color=#ffe08f>organ</color> provides the means for reproduction?
en.start_lesson_6_subsystem_result0: The <color=#ffe08f>ovary</color> ('egg' in English) is an ovum-producing reproductive organ, often found in pairs in the female body of the <color=#ff807b>reproductive system</color>.
en.start_lesson_0_system_interaction_questi: Which of the <color=#ff807b>two systems</color> work closely together in the exchange of <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> and <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color>?
en.start_lesson_1_system_interaction_questi: Which of the <color=#ff807b>two systems</color> work together in <color=#9cd395>breaking down</color> the <color=#ffe08f>food</color> we eat into <color=#ffe08f>nutrients</color>, and then <color=#9cd395>deliver</color> the <color=#ffe08f>nutrients</color> to the other <color=#ff807b>body systems</color>?
en.start_lesson_2_system_interaction_questi:
<color=#ff807b>One system</color> <color=#9cd395>collects</color> <color=#ffe08f>waste products</color>, and <color=#9cd395>turns</color> them into <color=#ffe08f>urine</color>.

<color=#ff807b>Another system</color> lets the body <color=#9cd395>know</color> when to release those <color=#ffe08f>wastes</color>.
en.start_lesson_3_system_interaction_questi: <color=#ff807b>One system</color> <color=#9cd395>brings</color> in <color=#ffe08f>oxygen</color> and <color=#9cd395>removes</color> <color=#ffe08f>carbon dioxide</color> that is <color=#9cd395>produced</color> by the <color=#ff807b>other system</color> as it <color=#9cd395>contracts</color> and <color=#9cd395>relaxes</color> when a person performs <color=#ffe08f>physical activities</color>.
